Sentencas: Ni-YSZ (yttria stabilized zirconia) cermets are the most widespread composite materials to be used as SOFC fuel electrodes.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: These materials are generally fabricated by the reduction of NiO to Ni in a NiO-YSZ composite, where the reducing conditions have a great effect in the final microstructure of the electrode.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: In the present work, several reducing conditions were explored in order to find the most suitable microstructure for anode-supported microtubular solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: Samples were firstly reduced in either pure or diluted H-2 (dry or humidified), at temperatures ranging from 400 to 800 degrees C while their DC conductivity was monitored.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: The highest conductivity value was measured for the sample reduced in pure humidified hydrogen at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: However, this sample experienced conductivity degradation in comparison with samples reduced under dry conditions.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: For the studied temperature range, nucleation of nano-porous nickel particles is firstly formed during reduction.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets

Sentencas: However, from our experiments it was concluded that those nanoparticles are not stable with time, at least at temperatures between 600 degrees C and 800 degrees C. Electrochemical characterization of complete microtubular cells under real wet conditions was also performed under current load, confirming that the microstructure of the Ni-YSZ cermet is still evolving during operation.
Titulo: The influence of the reducing conditions on the final microstructure and performance of nickel-yttria stabilized zirconia cermets
